intro: Mapouria sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower mapouria, is a tropical plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other plants like the cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a small, round drupe that contains a single seed.
